The UP1

Bring it to Life

Building a robot is hard. Trust us, we've been working on it for a while and its just hard. Programming a robot is fun but building it, well it can get messy pretty quickly.

The UP1 was created so that you could skip that first part and get on to the tinkering. It's ready to go out of the box, you just need to tell it what to do.

Whether you write your own robotics application, or download a package from a selection of pre built behaviors, what you do with the UP1 is up to you.

To find out when the UP1 is rolling out, join our mailing list. UpDroid loves you.

Sign Up Now

UP1 Assemble!

One robot, many configurations. Want to run your updroid with spider legs? One arm instead of two? No prob, swap it out.

UP1-Core

Every robot needs a brain, at least a smart one does. The UP1-Core plugs into the back of the base and enables the UP1 to carry out its tasks.

The first iteration of our boards will have an Intel Atom chip, wifi, a battery indicator, 3 axis accelerometer, and a gyroscope.

Base

The foundation upon which the UP1 comes together, the base houses the internals including 4 IR sensors and offers mobility at .7 meters per second with its 4 wheel setup. Future iterations will offer different options for movement.

Manipulator

It's an arm. It manipulates the world around it. Sounds simple but its a pretty big deal. Without it, the updroid would just be driving around taking notes.

360 mm reach
36 mm gripspan
10 - 13 oz / arm load capacity

I / O

It sees, it hears, it speaks. The I/O module (Input / Output) snaps on top of the base and gives the UP1 the senses it needs to perceive the world around it.

It's core components are a front facing cameras, a speaker, and a microphone for voice detection.

UP1 Assembled!

All parts together, you have one happy robot.
